column4: dpkg: subprocess post-installation script returned error exit status 1
i was updateing from 9.04 to 9.10 and now i cant install anything
can someong google something 4 me
use pastebin to show the entire error you're getting
for what package?
for what package?
that error message refers to a specific package. need to at least know the name of it
it sould show as part of the messages from when you do 'dpkg-reconfigure -a'... there shuold be more than just one line to the error
ok. well, now you need to use a command line text editor. ever used one before?
can you use gedit right now?
/var/lib/dpkg/status
ok, cool. i didn't think you were in X Windows ;-)
you see in there how every package has a 'section' in that file?
ok, you need to find the section for linux-restricted-modules-generic, and just delete the entire section for it
then save the file and try...  sudo apt-get -f install
darn. try that command. what package is it giving en error for now?
are you sure you took out the entire section in the file that refers to that package? and then saved it? you would have needed to edit the file as 'root'
ok, sounds better
try... sudo apt-get -f install
you're trying to update to 9.10.. is that right?
well what happens if you try.... apt-get install linux-image-2.6.28-18-generic
i don't know
no
